content: watch house chunky by susan ashcroft yarn requirements chunky/bulky weight yarn which gets gauge such as malabrigo vientos or mamie and florrie mega mohair allow approx 130m/165 yds gauge approx 15sts per 10cm/4 in rib stretched as for wear row gauge approx 24 row per 10cm/4 but is not at all critical size approx 53cm/22 mamie and florrie suri silk dk on 4 5mm/us7 notions 1 stitch marker to mark the end of round you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked optional 3 extra markers to mark repeats for the to the pattern page on ravelry - link crown needle size short circular abbreviations and explanations if you have average gauge 4 5mm/us 7 k = knit if you are a tight knitter size up p = purl if you are a loose knitter size down st s = stitch es p2tog = purl 2 sts together tbl = through the back loops rs/ws right side/wrong side mimichevol king cole chunky tweed © susan ashcroft 2026 - for personal non-commercial use only 2 watch house - chunky making the hat cast-on 80sts using cable cast-on link http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html place a marker and join to work in the round taking care not to twist the stitches tip check after the first round if there is a twist you can still untwist at that point check the fit after about 10 rounds rib round 1 on the chart round 1 *k2 p2 repeat from * to end of the round repeat round 1 until the hat is approx 20 22 cm/8 - 9 tall then work the crown the crown will add just under 2 /5cm tip if you want to gauge the precise height of your hat measure 10 rounds on your knitting that is the additional height that will be added by the crown at your row gauge crown rounds 2 10 on the chart the number of stitches indicated is per repeat tip if you like you can mark the crown repeats either place a marker every 20 sts before you start round 2 or after each repeat as you work round 2 p2tog tbl this stitch is used to make the hat reversible it can be replaced by p2tog which is easier to work with bulky yarn but then you won t have matched decreases work rounds 2-10 once from the written version or the chart below pull the yarn end through the final 12 sts to secure block lightly if you wish round 2 k2 p2tog k2 p2 × 3 k2 p2tog tbl 18 sts round 3 k2 p2tog k1 p2 k2 × 2 p2 k1 p2tog tbl 16 sts round 4 k2 p2tog p2 k2 × 2 p2 p2tog tbl 14 sts round 5 k2 p2tog p1 k2 p2 k2 p1 p2tog tbl 12 sts round 6 k2 p2tog k2 p2 k2 p2tog tbl 10 sts round 7 k2 p2tog k1 p2 k1 p2tog tbl 8 sts round 8 k2 p2tog
